New Records: Mushfiqur Rahim scored 66 runs off 75 balls, including six fours and two sixes, marking his 48th half-century in ODIs; Trent Boult achieved his 200th ODI wicket
Key Match Events: Mushfiqur Rahim played a pivotal role in resuscitating Bangladesh's innings after they were struggling at 56-4; Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur formed a crucial 96-run partnership; Trent Boult dismissed Liton Das and Towhid Hridoy to reach his milestone; Captain Kane Williamson returned to action after missing New Zealand's first two wins due to a knee injury
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Kane Williamson returned to action after missing New Zealand's first two wins due to a knee injury
Post-Match Reflections: Shakib Al Hasan ended his innings suffering from cramps in the sweltering heat; Mushfiqur's brother-in-law Mahmudullah added a valuable undefeated 41 runs; Bangladesh opened their World Cup campaign with victory over Afghanistan before losing to England
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under sweltering heat; Bangladesh's innings struggled initially but were resuscitated by Mushfiqur and Shakib's partnership; New Zealand's performance was marked by Boult's milestone and early dismissals
